subject: Career
title: The Autonomy-Stress Connection
description: Learn The Autonomy-Stress Connection in one minute.

hook.text: Two workers face the same deadline. One chooses how to approach it, the other is micromanaged. Who burns out?

buildup.text: The Whitehall studies tracked 10,000 British civil servants and found a shocking pattern about stress and control.

discovery.text: Lower-rank workers with less control had higher stress, more heart disease, and shorter lives â€” despite easier tasks.

twist.text: It's not the workload that kills. It's the lack of control over how you handle the workload.

climax.text: Wherever possible, negotiate for autonomy. Choose your methods even if you can't choose your targets.

punchline.text: Control over your work is more important than the amount of work.

quiz.question: What did the Whitehall studies reveal about stress?
options: Lack of control over work causes more stress than the workload itself
All workers had equal stress levels
